title-group.article-title: LOCAL COMPUTATION OF DIFFERENTS AND DISCRIMINANTS

abstract.p: We obtain several results on the computation of different and discriminant ideals of finite extensions of local fields. As an application, we deduce routines to compute the ùî≠-adic valuation of the discriminant Disc(f), and the resultant Res(f,g), for polynomials f(x),g(x) ‚àà A[x], where A is a Dedekind domain and ùî≠ is a non-zero prime ideal of A with finite residue field. These routines do not require the computation of either Disc(f) or Res(f,g); hence, they are useful in cases where this latter computation is inefficient because the polynomials have a large degree or very large coefficients.
